# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.8d649254:
life_df['2018']= pd.to_numeric(life_df['2018'],errors='coerce')
life_df['2015']= pd.to_numeric(life_df['2015'],errors='coerce')
life_df['2016']= pd.to_numeric(life_df['2016'],errors='coerce')
life_df['2017']= pd.to_numeric(life_df['2017'],errors='coerce')
life_df['2019']= pd.to_numeric(life_df['2019'],errors='coerce')
life = life_df[life_df.Level == 'National'][['Country','2015','2016','2017','2018','2019']]
life['Sum'] = life.sum(axis=1, numeric_only= True)
life['Mean'] = life[['2015','2016','2017','2018','2019']].mean(axis=1, numeric_only= True)
life_sort = life.sort_values('Mean', ascending=False)
life_sort
# life_expect[life_expect.Country == 'Japan'][['Country','2015','2016','2017','2018','2019']]
source.1fafdf96:
dfm = life_sort.melt('Country', var_name='Year', value_name='vals')
filt =dfm['Country'].head()
data = dfm[dfm['Country'].isin(filt)]
data_mean = data[data['Year'] !='Mean']
data_filt = data_mean[data_mean['Year'] !='Sum']
data_filt
source.5fdea927: sns.lineplot(x= data_filt['Year'] ,y = data_filt['vals'],hue=data_filt['Country'], data = data_filt, palette="tab10", linewidth=2.5 )
source.126542c7:
USA = life_df[life_df.Country == 'United States'][['Country','Level','Region','2015','2016','2017','2018','2019']]
USA['Mean'] = USA[['2015','2016','2017','2018','2019']].mean(axis=1, numeric_only= True)
USA_mean = USA[USA.Level == 'National'][['Country','Region','Mean']]
USA_sub = USA[USA.Level != 'National'][['Country','Region','Mean']]
USA_sub
USA_mean
source.c7d24767:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,5))
plt.xticks(rotation='vertical', fontsize='10')
graph = sns.scatterplot(data=USA_sub, x=USA_sub['Region'], y=USA_sub['Mean'])
graph.axhline(78.9)
plt.show()
